metadata.title: CVE-2024-38381 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfc:nci: Fix uninit-value in nci_rx_work syzbot reported the followinguninit-value access issue [1] nci_rx_work() parses received packet fromndev->rx_q. It should be validated header size, payload size and totalpacket size before processing the packet. If an invalid packet is detected,it should be silently discarded.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38381` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
